Description: Please note that our customer lift will be undergoing repairs from Monday 4 March for four weeks, with current expected completion date of Monday 1 April.During that time our events space will unfortunately only be accessible via stairs. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause. If you expect you will have difficulty accessing one of our events during this period please contact us on Events.GlasgowSauchiehallST@waterstones.com The second book in the Nightfall Saga, the stunning new epic fantasy series set in the world of the Demon Cycle, from New York Times bestselling author Peter V. Brett. Humanity thought the war with demonkind was over. Now, after less than a generation to rebuild, the demon corelings have returned with a vengeance. The Spear of Ala‚Äîthe fortress that stands at the gates of the demon‚Äôs hive‚Äîis the last bastion against the horde, and reports say it may already have fallen. Olive Paper is expected to take the vanguard in the fight. Only an heir of Kaji can wield the artifact that opens the gates of the Spear of Ala, and as Ahmann Jardir‚Äôs child, Olive seems destined for a role as leader and savior. But Olive does not wish to follow in her father‚Äôs footsteps any more than she did her mother‚Äôs. Darin Bales was born with supernatural senses that he struggles to process, so much that even those who love him believe he can barely take care of himself. Yet to save his mother from the clutches of Alagai Ka, the demon king, Darin will brave anything to mount a rescue. Darin and Olive each strive to walk their own path but find themselves inextricably tied to the legacies of their parents and to a fated confrontation with the demon king and his new hatchling queen. If they fail, humanity may not survive.
Title: An evening with Peter V Brett - Glasgow Sauchiehall St
Subtitle: Join best selling author as he launches The Hidden Queen

Description: Chemistry of the Evening Raise your glasses, you fine and eligible singles, you are in for a wonderful night of dating. Meet like-minded singles face-to-face at our busy speed dating event at August House. It's time to relax, make real life connections and meet your perfect partner in crime! Here, at SpeedDater we know that chemistry only happens in person, so our events are perfect for singles that want to meet people in real life. During the event, you will be going on between 8 and 12 mini dates lasting about four minutes each. Our professional hosts and well-organised events make meeting people easy and lots of fun. Come with a smile and an open mind, you never know who you could meet at one of our events. What to Expect: Mix, Match, Date When you arrive, our lovely SpeedDater host will welcome you and sign you in. You will be given a badge number that will match a table in the room and the ladies stay seated while the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman. To help you remember all participants you will have a card to mark down all individuals that you like. There will be a break halfway through the dating for you to refill and recharge. And after the event? The day after your speed dating event you can log in to our secure website and click the 'matches' tab. You will find out who you mutually matched with and can get in touch again via our messaging system. Don‚Äôt forget about SpeedDater‚Äôs guarantee - if you didn‚Äôt meet someone you liked the first time your next singles event is free! What have you got to lose? Itinerary 19:00 Registration opens 19:30 Speed Dating begins 20:15 Break for drinks and chatting 20:30 Speed Dating resumes 21:30 Speed Dating ends and post event socialising begins Please have a look at our upcoming events: www.speeddater.co.uk
Title: Glasgow Speed Dating | Ages 24-38
Subtitle: Glasgow Speed Dating | Ages 24-38

Description: Love Music Hate Racism comes back to the West End! We're hosting a gig at Jim‚Äôs Bar in the Queen Margaret Union! Line-up includes: Suzy Lee Kidd is a resident DJ for Radio Buena Vida. She was part of Common People which ran for 7 years in the Flying Duck and can now be found running Different Class at The Rumshack. Specialising in indie, post punk and britpop. More TBA... Open to all students and the general public Join anti-racist music lovers from across Glasgow to celebrate what unites us and build for the #MarchOnTheHomeOffice to #StopRacism #StopTheHate and say #AyeWelcomeRefugees! We are the majority and we will stand up to racism. Love Music Hate Racism (LMHR) uses the energy and vibrancy of the music scene to promote unity and celebrate diversity through education and events. Our message is simple, there is more that unites us than divides us; and nothing demonstrates this more than music. Whatever the genre, music is living testimony to the fact that cultures can and do mix. Music has the power to unite, to give strength and to effect positive social change. Racism, on the other hand, weakens us; it creates barriers and turns friends and neighbours against one another. Sadly, racism is on the rise in the UK and internationally. We believe that if we work together we can harness the power of music to stop this destructive force in its tracks. Our aim is to use the power of music to bring together individuals and communities in a beautiful resistance against bigotry and hatred.
Title: Party with a purpose: Love Music Hate Racism @ QMU
Subtitle: Dance against hate, boogie against the bigots

Description: The Health & Safety Executive‚Äôs latest guidance states that managers must make sure that their risk assessment covers home workers. They advise that employers: ¬∑ meet any special requirement, such as for a worker with a disability. ¬∑ assess if the work activity includes significant hazards like tools or chemicals. ¬∑ assess how work can be done safely. ¬∑ determine control measures that should be put in place. They also state that you should consider the safe use of computer equipment, assess the working environment for accident risk, and monitor workers‚Äô stress and mental health. This half day course, delivered by an experienced workplace health & safety tutor, will help managers to get an overview on the topic. We also provide checklists and templates for you to use as part of your own assessment process. -------------------------------------- FAQS ABOUT THE COURSE Do I have to book using Eventbrite? No. You can simply contact us at¬†training@civicostraining.org¬†with your name, organisation, billing address and a note of any access issues. We will issue an invoice in advance of your attendance. Is my registration/ticket transferrable? If you want to transfer to another training course, please contact us with five or more days‚Äô notice¬†at¬†training@civicostraining.org What is the refund policy? Civicos Training requires five working days' notice of cancellation. We will always attempt to place you on a later version of the same course, or transfer your booking to another course at no extra cost. However, if you cancel with less than the required notice, we do reserve the right to charge for the full cost of the course
Title: Risk Assessing Your Home Working Environment
Subtitle: Make sure that you and other staff have a safe home working environment

Description: This training is suitable for everyone who has an interest in learning the basic first-intervention skills that can prevent an accident or medical emergency from escalating into something much worse.  The course first looks at how best to assess the situation. What is the issue? Is the person responsive? Can they breathe? Are you the best person available to help? We then look at the skills to make basic interventions in different accidents and emergencies, whether it be bleeding, choking, chest pains or burns. This training is certificated by FAA and is SCQF Level 6. FAQs Do I have to book using Eventbrite? No. You can simply contact us at¬†training@civicostraining.org¬†with your name, organisation, billing address and a note of any access issues. There is a flight of stairs at the front of the building, however, so wheelchair access is at the rear. A Civicos staff member can be on hand to assist, as the entry point is not obvious. We will always attempt to place you on a later version of the same course, or transfer your booking to another course at no extra cost. However, if you cancel with less than the required notice, we do resrve the right to charge for the full cost of the course

Description: This is a hands on type event in which you‚Äôll learn how you can use the natural environment to improve your mental and physical health. We‚Äôre going to cover how to build, maintain and light that most ancient of outdoor essentials - the campfire. Then we‚Äôll learn about a few delicious things you can cook on it. We‚Äôll look at how to put up a simple and effective tarp shelter to keep you and your people dry if it rains. We‚Äôll also explore some ‚Äòback pocket‚Äô skills that quickly restore your mental baseline such as forest bathing, deliberate attention and journalling. There is just over 100 years of research into how the natural environment can restore us and it‚Äôs pretty conclusive. Being outdoors lowers your blood pressure and stress levels, it improves cognitive function, helps you sleep better and elevates mood. If it came in tablet form we‚Äôd all be taking it. We‚Äôre using the awesome Beechbrae Woodland Centre which offers a combination of top end indoor and outdoor work spaces. Check out the photos Useful to know The centre has a policy of no outdoor shoes in the building so please bring a pair of slippers or thick socks. We‚Äôll be working outside for most of the day so please bring warm clothes and a waterproof jacket. Lunch is provided with vegetarian and vegan options. There is also tea and coffee available throughout the day. If you‚Äôre coming by train the nearest station is Blackridge, about 1 mile from the Beechbrae Centre. If you get there a bit early we can come and pick you up.
Title: Outdoor wellbeing and bushcraft
Subtitle: The outdoors can make you  great; happier, healthier, stronger. In this workshop we're going to look at a  bunch of ways to do just that!

Description: Maintaining oxygen to the brain and heart does not just save a life but also helps avoid brain damage...transforming the life of a little one! Whatever your role: parent, neighbour, friend or professional such as schoolteacher or child minder, this course will give you vital skills that could help preserve or restore life to an infant or young child. As a first responder, early delivery of CPR has been shown through medical research to make all the difference in the world! This course will help you to develop life-saving skills which can keep a person alive until professional help arrives. These skills include safe assessment of the collapsed individual, dealing with a choking baby or child, effective airway management (‚Äòkeeping the breathing passageways open‚Äô), and how to competently perform CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation) if necessary. There are no eligibility restrictions for this course ‚Äì it is open to any member of the public or professionals who would like to learn the first responder emergency care skills for both babies and children. This course meets the UK and European Resuscitation Council Guidelines 2021. Cost is ¬£25. For more details, please email us for information (admin@clinical-training.co.uk). This is a face-to-face course, with pre-course e-learning.
Title: Baby and Child Life Support (Paediatric BLS)
Subtitle: Professional training in infant and child CPR in Glasgow City Centre

Description: Awaken your mind and body to a new level and learn how to practice meditation in motion. And to feel the effects of a posture. Learn to consciously encounter your "edge" of body and mind to release deep tensions and restore the natural flow of the vital life force energy (prana). This is your opportunity to grab a co-driver on your journey to success. Let Tammy guide you from feeling like an old rusty transit van to become a supercharged, future-ready economic power machine! In just 22 minutes, you will have the tools and knowledge to bring balance into your life without compromising your success. Here's what you can expect: ‚úî Discover the direction you want to travel in and improve your focus. ‚úî Learn how to navigate life with grace and conviction, overcoming obstacles. ‚úî Develop a bold and empowering self-image that goes beyond your current limitations. ‚úî Boost your self-esteem and feel better about yourself, even when alone. ‚úî Break free from the habit of overestimating tomorrow and start harnessing the power of today. ‚úî Create a compelling vision for your life and use it as fuel for your daily actions. ‚úî Identify gaps in your social circle and cultivate new empowering relationships. ‚úî Embrace the notion that being selfish and prioritising your well-being is okay. ‚úî Learn how to prepare for today to avoid unnecessary repairs in the future. After the webinar, you will receive a private 60-minute coaching session with a world-renowned personal development coach. In this personalised session, Tammy will work with you to craft a life plan tailored to your unique goals, with actionable steps you can implement immediately. This coaching session alone is valued at ¬£145, but as part of this limited-time offer, it's included with your webinar registration. Take advantage of this incredible opportunity to revolutionise your life. Join us for the event. Tammy is not only an entrepreneur and philanthropist but also an unwavering optimist who is dedicated to helping people overcome any obstacles that prevent them from achieving a balanced and successful life.  From a young age, Tammy has always valued leadership while maintaining a healthy work-life balance. However, her journey to success was not without its challenges. Tammy has faced unemployment, heartaches, and embarrassing mistakes. Despite these setbacks, Tammy launched a successful business without substantial resources, built efficient systems, and grew an empowered team to achieve her goals.  She now has the freedom to do more in less time. Tammy's innate abilities and lessons have empowered many to start, grow, or diversify their businesses or careers, enabling them to design fulfilling and purposeful lives.
Organizer: Tammy Whalen-Blake at Go To Yellow
Title: Master Your Mind, Elevate Your Performance, and Boost Your Energy Levels: T
Subtitle: Unlock the secrets to supercharging your life, achieving balance, and unleashing your true potential

Description: Dinner and a movie are soooo last decade. Instead, you can go on a cute & immersive scavenger hunt in the city that has more connections to romance than many give it credit for. Rose gardens, vast parks, galleries and a rich history are just a few such details that give the most populous city in Scotland the edge.  In this game, you'll learn why the Necropolis has any business being as charming as a candlelit dinner for two  and what strange new Glaswegian tradition involves proposing in the presence of a box of old bones.  Are you ready for a romantic adventure in Glasgow? We are inviting you two (or you three - hey, we don‚Äôt judge!) to a romantic couples activity that‚Äôs part outdoor escape room, part scavenger hunt and part walking tour.  We promise this experience will make you want to kiss and tell <3. We‚Äôve hosted more than 20.000 dates this year. So, we‚Äôre pretty sure you will absolutely love it too!  If you don‚Äôt, let us know and we‚Äôll live the rest of our lives in shame. So, we‚Äôre pretty sure you will absolutely love it too!  But if you don‚Äôt, let us know and we‚Äôll live the rest of our lives in shame. WHAT WILL YOU DO‚ùì - Witness some of the best tucked-away green spaces of Glasgow  - Find out why keeping a traffic cone on the Duke of Wellington‚Äôs head is a good thing - Take a romantic stroll along the River Clyde - Learn about the unsolved mystery behind Wincher‚Äôs Stance HOW DOES IT WORK‚ùì The entire experience is delivered through a mobile app. 1. Book your tickets üé´. 2. Get the instructions via email. 3. Download the Questo mobile app (as instructed via email) and head to the starting point on any day that you chooseüìç. 4Ôªø. Invite your significant one. FEATURES ‚úîÔ∏è - Available 24/7. - Pause and resume anytime. - Private. -Ôªø A bunch of cute & instagrammable places. WHEN CAN YOU TRY THIS EXPERIENCE‚ùì - date night - anniversary - birthday celebration - holiday date - Valentine‚Äôs Day - as a gift for any occasion AÔªøGE RECOMMENDATION If you have little ones and want to bring them along with you, feel free to do so, this experience is kid friendly.
Title: Romantic Glasgow: Cute Scavenger Hunt for Couples

Description: Founded in 1451, the University of Glasgow is the fourth-oldest university in the English-speaking world. Originally located on High Street in the city centre near Glasgow Cathedral, in 1870 it moved to the stunning collection of buildings perched upon Gilmorehill today, where it continues to watch over the bustling city and picturesque tenements of Glasgow‚Äôs West End. This walking tour will take you on a fascinating journey around some of the university‚Äôs most significant spots - from philosopher Thomas Reid‚Äôs tombstone and the atmospheric cloisters to the very same staircase Lord Kelvin would take from his house to his laboratory - whilst discovering the connections of James Watt, Adam Smith and Isabella Elder whose names are inscribed on the university‚Äôs Memorial Gates. For your consideration, we have prepared a video preview of the tour:¬†University of Glasgow Tours Preview Scheduled Tours  Tours leave the East Undercroft  near the University Visitor Centre Tuesday - Sunday 2pm  Tickets  can be purchased via Eventbrite  in advance of the tour on by credit/debit card  at the Welcome Point McIntyre Building or to the guide just before the tour departs. . Maximum number on the tours will be 20 Private Groups Due to the number of scheduled tours being reduced we are currently offering private tours for 2 people or more, these can be booked  on any day  between 9am and 5pm.  Private tours  can be booked by emailing the addresses below, but please try and give us 24hrs notice to organise you a guide. TÔªøours will not be running over the Chrsitmas period last tour is the 18th December, with th Tours returning on the 5th Janaury. Leaving from the East Undercroft  near the Visitor Centre which is situated within the main building, just through the gates on University Avenue. The University is in the West End of the city, 2 miles from the city centre and round the corner from Byres Road and Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum. Assistance dogs are permitted in all areas. The majority of the tour is accessible for wheelchair users, although the route will deviate slightly to accommodate lift access. Due to the nature of University business access to all rooms cannot be guaranteed on all days. Our guides would be more than happy to let you into the SRC‚Äôs Gilchrist Postgraduate Club after your tour if you fancy a coffee or a panini, open 10am-4pm Monday-Friday.  The Club serves a selection of hot and cold beverages, paninis, sandwiches, nachos and a lovely range of home-baking. Currently this is operating on a takeaway bases only
Title: University of Glasgow Tours
Subtitle: This walking tour will take you on a fascinating journey around some of the university‚Äôs most significant spots, and see picturesque views.

Description: As new staff enter the school age childcare sector with fresh enthusiasm and new ideas, many of these recruits come into their role without any prior experience of the sector. This session has been created with this in mind, designed to give a fundamental understanding of play to those members of staff and volunteers who may have recently joined the school age childcare sector or who have never accessed training on the subject before. In this session, there‚Äôs three main questions we‚Äôre going to try and answer. WHY is play important? WHAT is play? HOW can we support play? As members of the school age childcare sector, or what we used to refer to as the out of school care sector, we have a responsibility to advocate for play. To do that effectively, we must strive towards becoming experts in play, as we continue to further professionalise the sector. This session should put you on that path!
Organizer: Scottish Out of School Care Network
Title: In-Person Play Training - Stirling
Subtitle: An understanding of play for members of staff and volunteers who may have recently joined the school age childcare sector

Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate						 Language: English Duration: 1 Day																						   Credits: 8 Course Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual Live/ On-Site Course  Overview: Have you ever found that you had differences with another individual, whether a partner, a colleague, a friend, a child, a boss or even a complete stranger? Then you have been confronted with the need of putting your negotiation skills at work. Yes, negotiation is the way by which people settle disputes of any kind.  In this course, the participants will learn about successful negotiation techniques and using them effectively in a different situation and with people of different levels of power. The participants will learn how their negotiation skills impact the organizations that they represent and their personality. The course also reflects the different types of outcomes that are achieved while negotiating and understanding which of these outcomes can be accepted and which one cannot be accepted. At last, but not least, the course also reflects on the influencing process and how things can be achieved without having the proper authority or power.  After a brief introduction each participant has 1 to 2 minutes to introduce themselves and put their presentation and communication skills in practice among the audience for the first time (if the intake has included the requested video, this introduction will only be 1 minute).  Each module has been carefully selected based on the intake and skills gaps of the specific audience. Each section includes the presentation of two modules, followed by a break. After the final reflection the class is dismissed.  Learning Objectives: Prerequisites: Participants must have attended a professional training about Negotiation skills. Through this workshop your participants will become more confident and relaxed in front of an audience which will translate into a successful speaking event. Leading Effective Teams Training: This training based on leading teams will help you to develop anyone that leads a team or is involved in a leadership role. Conflict Management Training: Disagreements, differences of opinion and conflicting perspectives on key issues inevitably arise in any context where people are working together. Research has shown that workplace conflicts can become highly destructive. Negative emotions may be stirred up, poisoning team morale, creating stress and destroying relationships. Power Query and Power Pivot for Excel Training: Power BI (including Power Query & Power Pivot) are the biggest Excel news items in the last 10 years. They give Excel users the power to draw information out of multiple sources, link it together then perform calculations on it that can then be sliced & diced any way you want. To be successful, every organisation needs good managers. Manager Management  Training: With this course, you will be able to provide the skills, guidance, and empowerment to your team of managers. Through this workshop, you will be able to disperse your knowledge and experience throughout your leadership team. The world's fastest growing and most successful businesses have one thing in common: they have effective sales people that drive their business forward. The course also reflects the different types of outcomes that are achieved while negotiating and understanding which of these outcomes can be accepted and which ones cannot be accepted. At last, but not least, the course also reflects on the influencing process and how things can be achieved without having the proper authority or power.  After a brief introduction, each participant has 1 to 2 minutes to introduce themselves and put their presentation and communication skills into practice among the audience for the first time (if the intake has included the requested video, this introduction will only be 1 minute).  Each module has been carefully selected based on the intake and skills gaps of the specific audience. Each section includes the presentation of two modules, followed by a break. After the final reflection, the class is dismissed.  Learning Objectives: Prerequisites: Participants must have attended professional training in Negotiation skills. Course Materials: Students will receive a course manual with presentation slides and reference materials. Offers: Groups of 3 people 10% Discount Groups of 5 people 15% Discount Groups of 10 people 20% Discount Public Speaking Training: According to a 1973 survey by the Sunday Times of London, 41% of people list public speaking as their biggest fear. Forget small spaces, darkness, and spiders, standing up in front of a crowd and talking is far more terrifying for most people. Through this workshop your participants will become more confident and relaxed in front of an audience which will translate into a successful speaking event. Leading Effective Teams Training: This training based on leading teams will help you to develop anyone that leads a team or is involved in a leadership role. It is also useful for those that are about to embark on a position of leadership or need to develop their leadership skills. Train the Trainer Training: Whether you are preparing to be a professional trainer, or you are someone who does a bit of training as a part of their job, you always want to be prepared. Your participants will understand that training is a process where skills, knowledge, and attitudes are applied in a unique way. Presentation Skills Training: In a survey carried out amongst experienced, middle and senior executives, designed to determine the things that they feared most, public speaking came out as number one. Death was eighth on the list! So, most of us would rather die than stand up and present! Practical Sales Skills Training: These practical sales skills training has been developed for salespeople or people who are required to sell as part of their role. This course is applicable for both people relatively new to sales as well as those who have a lot of experience as the content is flexible enough to adapt to suit the audience. Conflict Management Training: Disagreements, differences of opinion and conflicting perspectives on key issues inevitably arise in any context where people are working together.
 Research has shown that workplace conflicts can become highly destructive. Negative emotions may be stirred up, poisoning team morale, creating stress and destroying relationships. Power Query and Power Pivot for Excel Training: Power BI (including Power Query & Power Pivot) are the biggest Excel news items in the last 10 years. They give Excel users the power to draw information out of multiple sources, link it together then perform calculations on it that can then be sliced & diced any way you want. Essential Management Skills Training: Every day, managers solve difficult problems, turn organisations around, and achieve astonishing performance. To be successful, every organisation needs good managers.
 Manager Management  Training: With this course, you will be able to provide the skills, guidance, and empowerment to your team of managers. They will then be better suited in leading and motivating their team and thus produce fantastic results. To be a successful manager means having a wide range of skills. Through this workshop, you will be able to disperse your knowledge and experience throughout your leadership team. Train the Trainer Training: Our Train-The-Trainer workshop will provide your participants the skills to help them deliver engaging and compelling workshops. Skills such as facilitating, needs analyses, and managing tough topics will give your trainees what they require to become a trainer themselves. Sales Presentation Mastery Training: Sales are the absolute most essential component of any business, and selling skills are the most highly valued skills in today‚Äôs business landscape. The world's fastest growing and most successful businesses have one thing in common: they have effective sales people that drive their business forward. Time Management Training: Personal time management skills are essential for professional success in any workplace. Those able to successfully implement time management strategies are able to control their workload rather than spend each day in a frenzy of activity reacting to crisis after crisis - stress declines and personal productivity soars! These highly effective individuals are able to focus on the tasks with the greatest impact to them and their organization. Internet Marketing Fundamentals Training: Marketing has changed dramatically over the last decade. Marketing is all about communicating, and the Internet has completely changed the way people communicate. The Internet is a marketer's dream come true, especially with social media, as you have a low-cost marketing tool that can reach a large audience. Description:
we are here to help you to establish  business in Dubai - United Arab Emirates at affordable rates with better support services . In the last two decades, Dubai has transformed from a local trading community into one of the most attractive business destinations. Dubai is a business attraction for people who want to expand business in UAE, Africa and Asia.
 
 Due to its geographical location, Dubai is an ideal gateway between the west and east.  Dubai opens for you a market of 2.2 billion people. It is also the most preferred hub for import and export business which is highly lucrative.
 
 WHY SET UP BUSINESS IN DUBAI?
 
 So let‚Äôs examine the advantages to setup business in Dubai:
 
 1. Growing and Diverse Economy
 
 Dubai has shown exponential economic growth in the last few years. After the 2009 recession, it successfully jumped back and diversified away from the Oil business. Today, about 60% of Dubai‚Äôs GDP is formed by tourism, logistics, and transportation and of course trade.
 
 2. Legal Framework
 
 Dubai is constantly improving its Investment laws and incentives to encourage foreign investment. It became the first emirate in UAE to provide foreign ownership of land, stock and property.
 
 3. Tax- Regime
 
 Dubai has a benign or you can say lenient tax-regime. Whether you set up a joint company in mainland or set up a business in Free zone- everyone enjoys tax-free haven. The 0% tax structure and low import duties make it an ideal destination to setup business in Dubai.
 
 4. Free Zones
 
 Dubai homes over 20 free zones catering to various industrial sectors. Setting up a business in Dubai free Zones gives the foreign investor 100% ownership of their business. Along with they enjoy benefits of no tax and other facilities in these free zones.
 
 5. Physical Infrastructure.
 
 Dubai is known for its world-class infrastructure. It has the best road networks, airports, ports and telecommunication facilities. Further, Dubai is heavily investing to develop better infrastructure facilities making it an attractive destination for investors.
 
 6. Visionary Leaders
 
 The vision, perception and belief of Dubai‚Äôs leaders transformed it from a traditional trading community to the modern and vibrant city it is today. Their belief in the potential of the future has made Dubai, what it is today. Their visions continue to grow and so will the business in Dubai.
 
 If you‚Äôre looking to expand your business, Dubai is definitely the destination. Dubai with its relaxed immigration formalities, increased foreign ownership, relaxed tax structure and world-class network and infrastructure, provides the ideal climate for business setup. CÔªøALL US /EMAIL US TO BOOK APPOINTMENT - FREE
Organizer: GLOCAL CORPORATE RESEARCH & INVESTIGATIONS PVT LTD
Title: Business in Dubai - UAE (set up new or manage existing)
Subtitle: SET UP BUSINESS IN DUBAI - UAE

Description: Wednesday 13th March 2024 -  Glasgow (venue to be confirmed) 9.30am - 4.00pm Essential learning for professionals and family members who support young people with additional support needs.  Young people with additional needs and their parents share their powerful experiences and personal learning of what helps and hinders the process of ‚Äòletting go.‚Äô Using our new transitions framework you will gain practical skills and resources to enable young people and families to prepare for and succeed in lifes big changes, including: - Leaving school or college - Joining social activities - Building relationships - Getting a job - Moving home. Delivered alongside staff from the Scottish Transitions Forum, Scotland's experts on improving support for young people with additional needs. Who is this for? Parents and carers of young people aged 14+ with additional support needs, and all the professionals who support them.  Cost:  Our Trainers  Alexander Warren‚ÄØis an actor, a teacher and a Hearts fan (please don‚Äôt hold that against him)! He runs his own business, AJP Dreams, to inspire young people to go for their dreams and to encourage families and professionals to listen and help - in particular, to imagine bigger and not simply make do with what appears realistic.‚ÄØ  David Warren ‚ÄØis a retired computer scientist. His son Alexander inspires people across Scotland by sharing his life story and experiences of living with a learning disability. David occasionally helps him write his presentations and gives a "parent's view". He is immensely proud of how his son has overcome his disadvantages in life, and his commitment to helping others.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ  Scott Richardson-Read co-facilitates the Scottish Transitions Forum, primarily working with a group of young people called the Divergent Influencers to ensure disabled and autistic voices are heard when it comes to transition. He works alongside professionals, software developers, academics, policy makers, local authorities, Scottish Government and third sector organisations to make sure growing up for young disabled, autistic, and other young people with additional support needs is the best it can be.  What you will learn.
Title: Learning to let go - Glasgow
Subtitle: Learn first hand from young people and parents! New approaches to support young people and their families take steps to greater independence

Description: When: Wednesday 13 March, 2.00-3.30pm Where: Abbot House workshop, 13 Maygate, Dunfermline Who: Adult 18+ Join Dunfermline based multi award-winning beekeeper Gael Wilkinson of Kin Bees for a truly unique experience. We‚Äôll be understanding what honey is, why and how honey is made and the harvesting process. What makes a good honey. Not forgetting the do‚Äôs and dont's of honey. Just like fine wine, every batch of honey is unique and we‚Äôll be sampling and comparing some exciting multi and mono-floral honeys from across the UK and the world, pairing them with a selection of cheeses and fruits while appreciating all of the bees delicious work. Part of Fife Food and Drink Week. Gael's bio After beginning working life in live music events (Oasis, Prince, U2, Paul Weller etc) and some years in Scottish Television‚Äôs development and distribution arm I took a career break to be a full-time mum. Finding myself at a loose end in the Middle East I entered the world of entrepreneurship and set up an Import/Export business and an interior design store GECKO. I‚Äôve created house party settings for Omani Royalty and furnished the terrace at The British Ambassadors‚Äô Residence for the Queen‚Äôs visit. After years of traveling far-flung shores and a mid-life slog through the world of University, like so many great ideas, Kin began as a hobby and became a passion. When I started with a single colony I had no idea that this cluster of bees and my painted hive was going to grow into an award-winning business with apiaries all around Dunfermline, West Fife and West Lothian and I certainly had no idea of the amazing connections around the world that bees would create for me. I adore bees and being a beekeeper and I think you can taste my enthusiasm and passion in every jar of Kin award-winning honey! PS Yes! I am really allergic to bee stings! Find out more about Kin Bees
Organizer: Dunfermline & West Fife Wellbeing through Heritage
Title: Show Me The Honey
Subtitle: Join Dunfermline based multi award-winning beekeeper Gael Wilkinson of Kin Bees for a truly unique honey talk and tasting experience.

Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate Language: English Duration: 1 Day Credits: 8 Course Delivery: Classroom / Virtual / On-Site Course Overview: This interview skills training will help your learners to develop their selection interviewing techniques. you will also develop many of the skills and techniques that will help you to use the structure effectively. Course Contents:  The selection of new employees can be a long drawn out and expensive process.  This means that we must do everything we can to ensure that when we do make a decision we choose the right person. Having gone to all the trouble of working through a selection process there is nothing worse than taking on a new employee who turns out   to be unsuitable. A robust selection process will minimise the risk of this happening and, of course, effective interviewing needs to be part of that. If you handle selection interviewing in a logical, structured and professional way the risk of choosing the wrong person is much smaller. This interview skills training concentrates on developing interview techniques. Although we will briefly touch on the laws of discrimination a detailed discussion of it is outside of the scope of this programme. Similarly the topics of Diversity and Equality of Opportunity will only be covered briefly. We concentrate on competency based interviewing skills in these training. This is sometimes described as behavioural, situational or job related interviewing. Course Topics: Course Feature: By the end of this Interview Skills training you will be able to: Certification: Once after the training you receive course completion certificate from Academy for Pros Who can Attend? Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate Language: English Duration: 1 Day																						   Credits: 8 Course Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual Live / Onsite Course Overview: This interview skills training will help you to learn and develop your selection interviewing techniques. You will also develop many of the skills and techniques that will help you to use the structure effectively. Course Contents:  The selection of new employees can be a long drawn out and expensive process.  This means that we must do everything we can to ensure that when we do make a decision we choose the right person. Having gone through all the trouble of working through a selection process there is nothing worse than taking on a new employee who turns out to be unsuitable. A robust selection process will minimize the risk of this happening and, of course, effective interviewing needs to be part of that. If you handle selection interviewing in a logical, structured, and professional way the risk of choosing the wrong person is much smaller. This interview skills training concentrates on developing interview techniques. Although we will briefly touch on the laws of discrimination a detailed discussion of it is outside of the scope of this program. Similarly, the topics of Diversity and Equality of Opportunity will only be covered briefly. We concentrate on competency based interviewing skills in this training. This is sometimes described as behavioral, situational, or job related interviewing. Course Topics: Similar Circles ‚Äì This icebreaker requires some listening and questioning and therefore provides a very relevant start to the training. The Selection Interview ‚Äì We explain what a selection interview is with particular reference to competency based interviewing. The learners then participate in an activity to identify the benefits and drawbacks of this approach before looking at ways to overcome those drawbacks. Diversity and Equality of Opportunity ‚Äì In this brief look at the topic Yare reminded of the importance of treating job candidates fairly. The PRICE structure ‚Äì Learners are introduced to our PRICE structure. PRICE organization ‚Äì In this activity learners consider 37 action cards that describe behaviors and techniques that may be used by interviewers. Their task is to fit these cards within the context of the PRICE structure. This will help them to develop a good understanding of PRICE and how they may be able to use it. Wrinkle Chaser ‚Äì You conduct a short interview activity to demonstrate the difficulty of interviewing without adequate preparation. The Selection Process ‚Äì Learners are reminded that interviews are a part of a selection process and do not normally stand alone Question Plans ‚Äì Preparing a question plan is identified as key to good preparation. Participants are encouraged to use a structured approach supported by our Question Plan template. First Impressions ‚Äì Learners take part in activities to help them consider both the importance of making the right first impressions on candidates and the danger that interviewers can be unduly influenced by their first impressions of interviewees. We also look at rapport building at the start of the interview. Traffic Lights ‚Äì In this activity learners consider nine different question types and decide whether they should be used in interviews. Effective Listening ‚Äì Learners identify barriers to effective listening and ways to overcome those barriers. The Close Phase ‚Äì This provides advice on what to cover with the candidate at the end of the interview. The Evaluation Phase ‚Äì Learners are encouraged to suspend judgement until the interview is over. They are then taken through an approach for evaluating and scoring the interview linked to their question plan. Interview Practice ‚Äì Learners take part in two or three interview simulations. They act as interviewer once and then as an interviewee and/or observer. Each of these roles gives them a different perspective of interviewing and will help them to apply the principles covered in this programme when they conduct real selection interviews in the workplace. They give Excel users the power to draw information out of multiple sources, link it together then perform calculations on it that can then be sliced & diced any way you want. Essential Management Skills Training: Every day, managers solve difficult problems, turn organisations around, and achieve astonishing performance. To be successful, every organisation needs good managers. Manager Management  Training: With this course, you will be able to provide the skills, guidance, and empowerment to your team of managers. They will then be better suited in leading and motivating their team and thus produce fantastic results. To be a successful manager means having a wide range of skills. Through this workshop, you will be able to disperse your knowledge and experience throughout your leadership team. Sales Presentation Mastery Training: Sales are the absolute most essential component of any business, and selling skills are the most highly valued skills in today‚Äôs business landscape. The world's fastest growing and most successful businesses have one thing in common: they have effective sales people that drive their business forward. Time Management Training: Personal time management skills are essential for professional success in any workplace. Those able to successfully implement time management strategies are able to control their workload rather than spend each day in a frenzy of activity reacting to crisis after crisis - stress declines and personal productivity soars! These highly effective individuals are able to focus on the tasks with the greatest impact to them and their organization. Internet Marketing Fundamentals Training: Marketing has changed dramatically over the last decade. Marketing is all about communicating, and the Internet has completely changed the way people communicate. Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate Language: English Duration: 1 Day																						   Credits: 8 Course Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual Live / Onsite Course Overview: Account Management is an important role within any organization. Account Managers are responsible for nurturing customer relationships and increasing sales with their organization's key customers. The Account Manager will usually act as a first point of contact for clients; responding to complaints, purchases, project requests and any general queries. Their approach should help maintain client relationships in order to ensure that they continue to use the company for business. This Account Management training materials are suitable for anyone that works in an account management role or relevant sales function and will assist the participants in improving their working practices, developing customer relationships and in turn increasing business performance and sales success. Course Contents: Build a strong account management team that are able to effectively manage customer relationships and drive sales The role of account manager is both important and demanding. The account manager acts as the ‚Äòface‚Äô of the business and should professionally represent the business by creating a strategy for success and delivering a high level of customer service. Account managers need to be effective communicators, needing to both engage with the client and also develop internal relationships to ensure promises are delivered upon. Another key responsibility of the account manager is to identify business opportunities and help drive business results for their company. Why is taking this Account Management training a good idea? Well, just imagine if you were better able to: Ultimately, this training will help employees to focus on what is required to succeed in the role of account manager, building a strategy with clear actions and helping the organization to business success. Account Management can be a very challenging role depending on the number of clients, the range of industries the clients represent, and the nature and attitude of the client. The main focus of the role is to provide continual client service to clients, this may include quarterly or annual business reviews, additions to the account in terms of extra services supplied plus face-to-face and online meetings, on a regular basis. The Account Manager will also be responsible for delivering high levels of client service to ensure that clients do not leave and will need to create a strategy around this. This strategy will depend on the type of client in terms of size of the business commitment, Key Performance Indicators plus contractual agreements which may dictate the framework for the relationship. Building a personal relationship as well as a business one is key to becoming an effective Account Manager. After all, ‚ÄúIt is easier to fire a business associate or employee than it is to fire a friend‚Äù. Course Topics: ‚òÖ	Case Study 1 ‚Äì A Multi-National Company ‚Äì Exploring the themes covered so far and introducing new learning points. Portfolio Analysis ‚Äì Assessing different accounts and defining key account attractiveness based on specific criteria. This helps identify potential customer growth rate, value and profit potential. Includes a review of existing accounts. Setting Performance Metrics ‚Äì Looking at lifetime value metrics for clients and measuring account management achievements. Understanding different performance metrics such as; client retention, revenue growth, relationship growth, profit margin, client satisfaction and how these can be set. Measuring Performance ‚Äì Completing a survey to establish how well current business metrics are being met and what gaps there may be. Understanding the challenge to measuring business metrics and the solutions we can put in place to deal with them. ‚òÖ	Case Study 2 ‚Äì A Local Organisation ‚Äì Exploring the themes covered so far and introducing new learning points. Key Account Plans ‚Äì Using these important tools to help build and maintain successful accounts. These help; identify strategic clients and accounts, track revenue against target, define strategy and targets, identify risks and implement corrective action where required. This section includes pan templates and a chance to practice understanding. Summary Activity ‚Äì Bringing it all together and establishing knowledge retention. Learning Logs and Action Planning ‚Äì Setting actions for further development. This course is highly interactive and contains exercises and activities to help keep you engaged and to ensure learning is embedded. Course Feature: At the end of this Account Management training you will be able to: Who can Attend? Anybody who is interested in learning Account Management Skills. Certification: Once after the training you receive a course completion certificate . Note: However, catering to the demands of busy professionals, our virtual training programs are as effective as face-to-face learning. Reach us at info@mangates.com for dates and details of instructor-led live Virtual Sessions.  If you would like to get this course customized and delivered exclusively for your group, we have an On-Site Training Option, you can reach us at info@mangates.com for more details about on-site or corporate training. Offers: Groups of 3 people 10% Discount Groups of 5 people 15% Discount Groups of 10 people 20% Discount Public Speaking Training: According to a 1973 survey by the Sunday Times of London, 41% of people list public speaking as their biggest fear. Forget small spaces, darkness, and spiders, standing up in front of a crowd and talking is far more terrifying for most people. Through this workshop your participants will become more confident and relaxed in front of an audience which will translate into a successful speaking event. Leading Effective Teams Training: This training based on leading teams will help you to develop anyone that leads a team or is involved in a leadership role. It is also useful for those that are about to embark on a position of leadership or need to develop their leadership skills. Train the Trainer Training: Whether you are preparing to be a professional trainer, or you are someone who does a bit of training as a part of their job, you always want to be prepared. Your participants will understand that training is a process where skills, knowledge, and attitudes are applied in a unique way. Presentation Skills Training: In a survey carried out amongst experienced, middle and senior executives, designed to determine the things that they feared most, public speaking came out as number one. Death was eighth on the list! So, most of us would rather die than stand up and present! Practical Sales Skills Training: These practical sales skills training has been developed for salespeople or people who are required to sell as part of their role. This course is applicable for both people relatively new to sales as well as those who have a lot of experience as the content is flexible enough to adapt to suit the audience. Conflict Management Training: Disagreements, differences of opinion and conflicting perspectives on key issues inevitably arise in any context where people are working together. Research has shown that workplace conflicts can become highly destructive. Negative emotions may be stirred up, poisoning team morale, creating stress and destroying relationships. Description: Learn about the wild greens emerging along the riversides in March and how to tap birch sap in the most simple, non-intrusive way.¬† ¬† Find out about making birch sap syrup and other early spring treats, and discover many more of the beautiful wild edibles growing in Edinburgh now. ‚ÄãFind our two local species of wild garlic, learn how to distinguish them from toxic look-alikes and  how to use them in the kitchen.  Compare phototoxic giant hogweed with edible common hogweed and learn how to safely distinguish them already by their first young leaves.  Discover many other species of edible wild greens and fungi  and learn how to best use them in the kitchen.   Go home with your freshly tapped sap and bursting with ideas for your own wild food creations. This course will include a wild food tasting (please make organiser aware of dietary requirements ahead of time) and is wheel chair accessible
Title: Birch Sap and First Green
Subtitle: Learn about the first wild edibles carpeting the riversides in early spring and how to tap birch sap.

Description: Ryan is currently undertaking his postgraduate studies at the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland. He is the first accordionist to be selected as a BBC New Generation Artist and his arrangement of Rameau for three accordions was performed for King Charles III during his official visit to the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland. Ryan's programme will include works by J. S. Bach, Scarlatti, Mozart, Alfred Schnittke, Vaclav Trojan, Mendelssohn, Vyacheslav Semyonov and Vladislav Zolotaryov.
Title: Ryan Corbett. Classical music on the accordion.
Subtitle: 'One of Scotland's most exciting young musicians' (The Scotsman)

Description: by D. C. Jackson Kill Johnny Glendenning is a play of two halves; each a brutally funny, finely-tuned treatise on the various overlapping hierarchies of power and violence that, while shaping our lives, can nevertheless be overturned unexpectedly. Kill Johnny Glendenning is a Scottish comedy crime thriller written by D C Jackson. It made its world premiere at the Royal Lyceum Theatre, Edinburgh in September 2014, before transferring to the Citizens Theatre, Glasgow. Performed by 4th year BA (Hons) Stage and Screen Acting students. Contains adult themes
Title: KILL JOHNNY GLENDENNING By D.C. Jackson
Subtitle: Kill Johnny Glendenning is  brutally funny, finely-tuned treatise on the various overlapping hierarchies of power and violence.

Description:
How do, and could, we preserve modern architecture? How can a conservation movement which originated two centuries ago with the preservation of ancient monuments engage with buildings and environments of a very different sort today? 
 In this panel event we conclude our series on conserving Scottish Modernism by bringing together current leaders in architectural conservation in Scotland to discuss how the organisations and frameworks with which they work might address the evolving question of caring for the past, in the present. 
 DÔªøoors open at 5.30 Panel discussion starts at 6 pm
Title: Panel Discussion: The Conservation of Scottish Modernism
Subtitle: In this event we conclude our series on conserving Scottish Modernism by bringing together current leaders in architectural conservation

Description: You can purchase a recording of the London event here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/the-goddess-path-with-kirsty-gallagher-recording-tickets-858852740667 Welcome to The Goddess Path tour. To celebrate the release of her new book, Kirsty invites you to join her for a 90-minute deep dive into the world of the Goddess. She‚Äôll take you on a beautiful journey through the pages of the book, her inspiration behind writing it and why it is so important in the current times we are living in to awaken the Goddess within. Learn about ancient Goddess magic, and how you can use it to reveal hidden parts of yourself. Kirsty will also lead you on a short guided meditation to meet the Goddess and close with a Q&A session. The Goddess Path is your invitation to activate your sense of wholeness, step into your feminine power and uncover who you truly are. This inspiring talk will open your eyes to the work and wisdom of Kirsty Gallagher and begin your journey to becoming the best version of your goddess-like self. Each ticket includes a signed copy of the book, which retails at ¬£16.99. Doors open at 6.45pm, talk starts at 7.30pm - come down early and grab a good seat! Kirsty Gallagher is the UK's leading voice in spirituality and soul-led personal development. She is a lunar guide, astrologist, spiritual mentor and Sunday Times bestselling author, renowned for her deep and innate knowledge of the divine feminine, Goddess energy, lunar cycles and astrology, living by the seasons, crystals, meditation and yoga. Kirsty teaches how to live back in alignment with your divine purpose and soul by reconnecting with ancient wisdoms and natural cycles. By weaving lunar, nature and Goddess wisdom with spiritual teachings and astrology, Kirsty helps women to step into their power by overcoming doubts, fears and self-sabotage. By making ancient mystical practices accessible and easily woven into everyday life, she invites you to live boldly and unapologetically and find greater meaning and purpose in life. ‚≠ê I can listen to you for hours explaining how our universe works, and in a way that makes it sound so simple, so impressed with your knowledge. ‚≠ê I have learnt so much and your work continues to inspire me and direct me to where I need to be. ‚≠ê Your guidance and kindness are really helping me to take care of myself more and more andto feel confident that my life is now opening up to all sorts of possibilities. Photo by Russ Williams This is a 16+ event.
Title: The Goddess Path with Kirsty Gallagher - Edinburgh
Subtitle: Venture onto The Goddess Path with Kirsty Gallagher, and discover how to become your most intuitive, authentic and powerful self.

Description: Everything you know about capitalism is wrong. We are thoroughly looking forward to welcoming one of the fiercest economic thinkers of her generation, author, journalist, and political commentator, Grace Blakeley, to Edinburgh on Wednesday 13th March at 7pm to discuss her searingly explosive and timely takedown of ‚Äòfree market‚Äô logic, as she charts a path forward based in hope, democracy, and liberation in her new highly anticipated book, Vulture Capitalism: Corporate Crimes, Backdoor Bailouts and the Death of Freedom.  Grace will be in conversation Co-Director of Future Economy Scotland, Laurie Macfarlane. Join Grace at the Nicholson Square Edinburgh as she talks about taking on the world's most powerful corporations by showing how the causes of our modern crisis are the intended result of our capitalist system. In Vulture Capitalism, Grace Blakeley explains that it‚Äôs not a broken system; it‚Äôs working exactly as planned. It can‚Äôt be fixed, instead it must be replaced. A polemic against the heroes of neoliberalism, and a primer on people-centred economics, Vulture Capitalism shows that as private interests have taken hold, states and corporations have shifted away from competition and democracy, towards a planned economic system that works for the few ‚Äì not the many. From Amazon to Boeing, Henry Ford to Richard Nixon, Blakeley looks at the past and present of our current crises to pinpoint exactly where it all went wrong. This is the book you need to understand what is happening in the world around you ‚Äì and what we can do to change it. Grace Blakeley, is an author, journalist, and political commentator. She attended University of Oxford where she graduated with a first-class honours degree in philosophy, economics, and politics. She has written for the Guardian, Tribune and the New Statesman among others, and appears regularly on television and radio, including on ITV Good Morning Britain, TalkTV and Jeremy Vine on Channel Five. She is the author of Stolen (Repeater) and The Corona Crash (Verso). Grace is based between London - Doors: 6.30pm, event starts: 7pm, please arrive early to secure a good seat. Tickets are ¬£7.00 (¬£5.00 for students) and there is a Ticket & Book option which includes a signed copy Vulture Capitalism. For more information or if you would like a signed copy because you can't make it to the event, please contact the Blackwell's events team on 0131 622 8222 or matthew.land@blackwell.co.uk
Title: Grace Blakeley: Vulture Capitalism
Subtitle: Join Grace Blakeley as she talks about her new book Vulture Capitalism

Description: Chemistry of the EveningRaise your glasses, you fine and eligible singles, you are in for an exciting night of dating. Meet like-minded singles face-to-face at our busy speed dating event at Le Monde, George Street, Edinburgh. It's time to relax, make real life connections and meet your perfect partner in crime!Here, at SpeedDater we know that chemistry only happens in person, so our events are perfect for singles that want to find someone special in real life. During the event you will be going on between 8 and 12 mini dates lasting about four minutes each. Our professional hosts and well-tried organisation make meeting people easy and a lot of fun. We are passionate about helping singles to find love in real life. Come with a smile and an open mind, you never know who you could meet at one of our events.What to Expect: Flirt, Laugh, MatchWhen you arrive, our lovely SpeedDater host will welcome you and sign you in. You will be given a badge number that will match a table in the room and the ladies stay seated while the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman. To help you remember all participants you will have a card to mark down all individuals that you like. You'll also have breaks for drinks and chit-chat.And after the event?The day after your speed dating event you can log in to our secure website and click the 'matches' tab. You will find out who you mutually matched with and can get in touch again via our messaging system. Don‚Äôt forget about SpeedDater‚Äôs guarantee - if you didn‚Äôt meet someone you liked the first time your next singles event is free! What have you got to lose? Itinerary 19:00 Registration opens 19:30 Speed Dating begins 20:15 Break for drinks and chatting 20:30 Speed Dating resumes 21:30 Speed Dating ends and post event socialising begins Please have a look at our upcoming events: www.speeddater.co.uk
Title: Edinburgh Speed Dating | Ages 35-55
Subtitle: Looking for love in Edinburgh? Join us for a fun-filled evening of speed dating exclusively for singles aged 35-55, happening on March 13th

Description: Book here to join a volunteer guide for a 45 min - 1 hour glimpse into the history, heraldry and life of our historic Cathedral and Thistle Chapel.  Groups will be a maximum of 10 people per tour. Space will be allocated on a first come first served basis. Bookings are by donation - pay as much or as little as you like, online or on the day. Please book together as a household, if you can.  If you have any access needs, please email info@stgilescathedral.org.uk to let us know, with your tour date as the subject line. Alternatively, call 0131 226 0674. We will do everything in our power to accommodate your needs. Please arrive 5 minutes before the tour starts. If you are late, we may give your slot away to someone else, so we cannot guarantee you will be able to join.  Please let us know if you cannot make the tour, as demand is high and so we will offer your space to someone else. Group tickets are capped at 5, if you wish to bring more than 5 people on a tour please contact us directly. Thank you.
Title: Daily Tour 10:30 (Mon- Sat) - March 2024
Subtitle: Join our friendly and knowledgeable guides to learn about the story of St. Giles'.

Refund_Policy: Kontaktieren Sie den Veranstalter, um eine R√ºckerstattung anzufordern.
Description: Dieser Anlass eignet sich besonders f√ºr Kinder im Alter von ca. 3 bis 12 Jahren. Wir treffen uns in den Meadows, an der Kreuzung des North Meadow Walks und des Middle Meadow Walks. Dort erfahren die Kinder ein paar wissenswerte Fakten √ºber Schottland, die lokalen Traditionen, die Tier- und die Pflanzenwelt. Danach machen wir uns auf zum Veranstaltungsort, wo wir uns zuerst einen Schottenrock zusammenschneidern, den die Kinder dann tragen und mit nachhause nehmen k√∂nnen. Wir werden schottische Lieder singen und traditionelle Ceilidh-T√§nze lernen. Auch ein kleines Mini-Highland-Game steht auf dem Programm. Au√üerdem lernen die Kinder, wie man ein traditionelles schottisches Dessert, den Cranachan, herstellt. Eltern insbesondere von kleineren Kindern sollten mitkommen. Sie werden sicher auch das Eine oder Andere √ºber Edinburgh und Schottland lernen. Gr√∂√üere Kinder k√∂nnen nach Absprache mit uns auch alleine teilnehmen. Die Teilnahme der Eltern ist kostenlos.
Title: Edinburgh: ein schottisches Erlebnis f√ºr Kinder
Subtitle: Wir stellen einen einfachen Kilt her, lernen schottische Lieder und T√§nze, essen ein schottisches Dessert und spielen Hochlandspiele.

Description: Mario and Luigi are two Italian plumbers in Brooklyn who find themselves sucked down a drainage pipe and transported to the Mushroom Kingdom & the Dark Lands. The separated brothers end up in very different circumstances, Mario coming to the service of Princess Peach, while Luigi is imprisoned by Bowser. After the box office failure of the Bob Hoskins' live-action feature back in 1993 (look out for a Grassmarket screening later in the year), this animated treat was one of the biggest box-office successes of the pre-Covid period.Notes: (PG) Features mild violence and some suggestion of threat.
Title: Young Programmers GCPH Screening: The Super Mario Bros. (2022)
Subtitle: Everyone's favourite Italian plumbers return to the big-screen, for animated adventures in this first chapter in a likely new franchise.

Description: Join composer & sonic artist Luci Holland at the Tinderbox Lab for a look at audiovisual creativity using visual programming tools! Some examples of the tools we'll be looking at are Max MSP (for reactive/interactive audio) and TouchDesigner (for generative visuals). This session will be aimed at beginners and is meant as an introduction and overview to looking at these tools, and will be casual, experimental, easy-going and fun! Together we will look at the basics of the softwares, some example projects that Luci has worked on previously, and experiment with some of the possibilities. Spaces are limited so please book to secure your place, with supported free spaces available for members of underrepresented groups - just contact us at lab@tinderboxcollective.org to request a free space. For ages 18+ Visual programming languages are found in applications and digital tools, that provide intuitive methods for creating interactive audio and/or visuals, without the need for writing code directly. Instead of generating audio or visuals by strictly using code or a scripting language, these softwares are usually node-based and provide graphical representation of how different components function and interact. These tools provide users different, accessible means to experiment digitally, to create unique and interactive art that can be intervened with through data streams and hardware inputs like webcams, microphones, headsets and more. What will I need? You will need: A laptop (preferably with webcam/mic input, but not essential) Headphones Max MSP downloaded, installed and app opened once - Max offers a free trial for 30 days,  with a $9.99 monthly subscription after (which can be cancelled anytime). Alternatively Max can be used without a subscription, but projects can't be saved TouchDesigner downloaded, installed and app opened once - TouchDesigner offers free non-commercial licenses for personal use, which is only slightly limited functionally If any of these requirements are a challenge for you please get in touch to let us know. About Luci Holland and the event: Luci Holland is an award-winning Scottish composer and sound artist who composes and produces music and audiovisual art for film, games and concert. She composed the original dynamic/responsive game music for Blazing Griffin‚Äòs 2018 release Murderous Pursuits, and live action fantasy film Sayo in 2020, with the soundtrack winning a New Music Scotland EVM Award for New Music in Media in 2021. More recently she has provided music & sound support for CRT7 by Scottish BAFTA-winning developer Amicable Animal; original game music for Playhead by Lowtek Games; and concept music for Personasmith by Thunkd (all currently in development), and is also currently working on several other unannounced games projects. She also builds and designs interactive sonic/art installations & creative technology-inspired live performances, most recently working on Dream Visualiser (with Alt-W 2023), Trees of Life (in collaboration with We Throw Switches and Robin Baumgarten in 2023), and Spectral Ballroom (a collaborative audiovisual work with Florence Richardson, Hidden Door 2022). She also works with Tinderbox Collective as a Programme Director for a range of interdisciplinary projects, exploring a crossover of games, art, creative technology and music. This workshop has been supported by the Creative Scotland Open Fund for Individuals, Tinderbox Collective, and The Wee Hub as part of a personal residency project Luci has been a part of from April 2023 - March 2024. About the Tinderbox Lab: Tinderbox Lab is Tinderbox's digital arts programme and makerspace. We bring together artists across disciplines with an interest in creative technology, electronics, interactive media, digital arts, games design, youth & community, and more; and we run a range of projects, events and opportunities. Visit our website for more information, feel free to contact us at lab@tinderboxcollective.org or join our mailing list here. Location: We are located on the 2nd Floor of the Ocean Terminal in Edinburgh, in the old Wagamamas unit (on the red car park side of Ocean Terminal). If the unit shutters are down ‚Äì ring Lab buzzer for access and someone will come to let you in. If you have access requirements please get in touch to let us know at lab@tinderboxcollective.org and we can provide assistance. With thanks to Creative Scotland, Tinderbox Collective, and The Wee Hub, for supporting this project.
Title: Experimental Creativity with Visual Programming
Subtitle: A look at audiovisual digital creativity using node-based tools Max MSP and TouchDesigner

Description: This journey will be taking place in the Studio which is up a set of stairs.All genders and sexualities are welcome. This blissful evening will begin with Blue Lotus Cacao to ready our minds for a fully connected experience. Cacao will be made with water that has been infused with Blue Lotus flowers, and organic rice syrup.  We'll breathe into ourselves, stretch or shake any stickiness and tension away, and begin deepening inwards to prepare for our journey.You'll be invited to get yourself comfortable however is best for you. Eyes open or closed, sitting or lying down, still or with movement. Once we've prepared ourselves for the meditation, it will begin alongside carefully selected music.  At the end you will be welcome to share, rest, leave, whatever will tie up this experience for you. There will be fruit available to snack on and art materials. You do not need to bring your own cup for Cacao, but if you have one you'd rather use then you're welcome to bring it.You're also welcome to bring your own blankets for the journey.
Title: Surrendering to Water Meditation Journey
Subtitle: An evening of Blue Lotus Cacao, guided meditation, and deep relaxation.

Description: Reiki is a special way of natural healing. It can help you rebalance to your natural state of wellness. The healer channels natural energy through her heart to her hands and connects this energy to you. Each session lasts for around 1 hour. We start with a calm chat about your health concerns. You lie peacefully (fully clothed) while the healer lays her hands - either hovering or touching - on the areas which need healing. Annabel adheres to the values of integrity, dignity and honesty and follows high professional standards. Reiki was first discovered in Japan. ‚ÄúRei‚Äù means universal life force. ‚ÄúKi‚Äù means the ‚Äúchi‚Äù or life force we all have in our body. Sometimes the flow of ‚Äúchi‚Äù in your body gets stuck due to emotional, mental and physical disturbances. Reiki helps to ease that flow. Reiki can be offered in-person and also by distance. For a distance healing the patient can be anywhere in the world, not in the same room as the healer. This happens at a high spiritual level. Annabel Allen brings a gracious reiki healing style to each patient. Annabel was trained in the Usui method of Reiki at the Shakti Healing Centre in Hong Kong and Lendrick Lodge in Scotland and is very grateful to her teachers. She first came across reiki as a patient when she felt a complete imbalance on all levels - physical, mental and emotional - during her divorce. She noticed the immediate effects - a pleasant gurgling internally as her energies shifted. She felt a release, a quiet relaxation and at the end of the session, stood up with renewed energy. After gaining profound healing over many sessions, she decided to train to become a reiki healer herself. Reiki is not a substitute for proper medical care. It is supportive healing and can be very effective as a supplement to necessary medical care. Reiki healing sessions with Annabel can be booked in advance. If the time you wish is not available here, please contact Annabel via the Eventbrite messaging system. Once your time is confirmed, she will set up a separate booking on Eventbrite. The healing sessions are held at Blue Morpho on Broughton Street. Free parking nearby is usually available, especially after 5.30pm.
Title: Reiki Healing - Love Life More
Subtitle: Reiki can help you rebalance to your natural state of wellness.  Come for a soothing healing session.

Your fairytale adventure will begin in the idyllic Dean Village, renowned for its tranquil atmosphere, rich milling history, and magical architecture.  There will be no shortage of romantic moments in dreamy settings, alongside fascinating local legends and history.  From there, you will follow the river past old mill buildings, Well Court; a World Heritage Site, the bustling, bohemian neighbourhood of Stockbridge, picturesque cobblestone streets such as Circus Lane, and the Botanical Gardens. Description: Explore this historic townhouse in the heart of Edinburgh's New Town. Designed in 1791 by Robert Adam, Scotland‚Äôs foremost architect of the time. Beautifully restored by the National Trust for Scotland in 1975. Step back in time to the elegance and refinement of late 18th Edinburgh.Discover the lives of those who lived in this family home. Find out about the life and work of the servants. No need to book a timeslot, please show your confirmation upon arrival, valid between 10am and 4pm. Opening times Monday to Sunday 10am‚Äì5pm. Last admission at 4pm. National Trust for Scotland/National Trust Members Member entry is free. Please show your membership card on arrival. Not yet a member? You can sign up to become a member at the Georgian House. Please ask a member of staff for more information. F ree admission to members of The National Art Fund. Ticket prices Your visit We welcome visitors of all ages to the Georgian House. Dressing up clothes, replica toys and handling objects are available for all. Additional activities and resources are available for families. Access to the property: We have limited access for wheelchair users ‚Äì there are six stone stairs into the building, and stairs up to the first and second floors and down to the basement. We do not have a lift. Please contact us before booking if you require further information. For visitors unable to climb stairs, the introductory film and an Armchair Guide are available on a tablet at the reception desk. During your visit This is a self guided visit. There will be guides in each room who are happy to provide information and answer questions. N o need to book a timeslot, please show your confirmation upon arrival, valid between 10am and 4pm. Visitor facilities We have two visitors‚Äô toilets located on the second floor. These toilets are cleaned regularly by staff during the day. Baby changing facilities are also available. Our shop will be open with a range of Scottish products and gifts.
Title: The Georgian House - Pre Booking
Subtitle: Step back in time to the elegance and refinement of late 18th Edinburgh. Explore this historic townhouse deigned in 1791 by Robert Adam.

Description: *class on the 22nd March will be restorative / yin practice *These classes are for LGBTQ+ people who would like to practice yoga at reduced cost. Open to ALL abilities, mobility and experience. We will have around a 60 minute movement and meditation practice, followed by optional tea and chat :) The sessions are pay what you can as we hope to make classes as accessible as possible if finances are a barrier for you. Please pay what you are able. If you are unable to pay you can still attend a session, just send us an email to let us know you will be joining. Your donation goes to support our community teachers and for hire of the space so we can continue running these classes. We hope to create a yoga community for queer folks to enjoy group practice and connect with others. Our classes will follow a gentle flow / slow vinyasa style, with a focus on finding some time for you, to find safety within your own body away from judgement or comparisons. A space where you can take a moment to notice how you feel as you take your time to move in a way that feels right for you and connect with your breath. These sessions will be lead by yoga instructors Lucy (she/her), Clemmie (she/her) and Ruth (she/her) supported by LGBT Health & Wellbeing. Mats will be provided but feel free to bring your own if you prefer. Blocks, blankets and eye pillows will be provided. Chairs can also be provided if needed for extra support - please just let us know at the start of class or earlier by email. We suggest you wear comfy clothes you can freely move in (joggers, shorts, T-shirts etc). We will be holding the sessions in the Lƒ´la Yoga Studio. The venue is situated on ground floor. There are all gender toilets available at the studio, without grabrails. Doorway to toilets are 26". When arriving at the building the front door should be open with a place to leave shoes at the door and a space to leave bags and coats at the back of the studio. If the door is locked please just knock and someone will welcome you in. Group size tends to be around 8-12 people. At the end of practice you will have the choice to stay for a complementary hot drink and chat, which we have in the studio. This lasts around 30 minutes but it's ok if you need to leave early.The front doorway is usually 25.5 inches wide as only half is open but the other side can be opened to make it 36.5 inches if needed. There is a very small (under1inch) step to get in. On Wednesdays we are usually in the studio at the back of the building. To get there, there are two steps together: first 6", second 6.5". Any questions at all, please get in touch. Hope to see you there!
Title: Queer Yoga Edinburgh @ Lƒ´la Yoga
Subtitle: Queer yoga open to everyone!
